zone.line: Until morning as at first Easter day
Permitted to me one & another question
With zeal have I me to studies applied
Truly know I much, yet might I all know.
As yet to the head not all hope dissappears
Which ever to the stale witness clings
With eager hand still the treasure buries
And happy is, when he an earthworm finds
Dares a such man's voice here
Where ghastliness me surrounds to sound?
Yet ah! for the present thank I you
The most miserable of all the sons of Earth
Thou tearest me from the despair loose
Which to me the senses already destroy would
Ah! the apparition was so giant-great
That I myself right like a dwarf perceive shall
